info.title: CakeAuth Backend API
info.description: OpenAPI documentation for interacting with CakeAuth Backend APIs

tags.name: Identifiers
tags.description: An identifier is set of informations that being attached to a user that can be used as an authentication identity. Use this set of endpoints to manage user's identifers. Read more about [direct identifier](/docs/guides/direct/overview) and [social identifiers](/docs/guides/oauth/overview).

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: A session is is a temporary state that keeps a user authenticated after they authenticate. Use this set of endpoints to manage sessions for users and its identifiers.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Use this set of endpoints to manage your user base. Learn more how you can manage users, [here](/docs/guides/manage-users).

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of identifiers filtered by user ID

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: CakeAuth ID or user's defined external_id

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new user identifer

delete.description: Delete an identifier from a user.

post.description: Set a password to a specific identifier data. Only works with [direct identifier](/docs/guides/direct/overview).

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of sessions filtered by user ID

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: CakeAuth ID or user's defined external_id

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new session for a user/identifiers
Refresh access token for a specific session. Learn more about sessions refresh mechanism, [here](/docs/concepts/how-it-works/token-refresh).
Revoke a specific session. The session's `status` will be changed to `revoked` and session is not valid and cannot be refreshed and/or used anymore.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of users in the current environment

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Free-text search values to filter users. Currently limited to search based off of the user's `id` and `external_id`.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new user data (optionally along with its identifier).

get.description: Get a details of a user's data

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID of the target users or value user's defined External ID

200.description: User's data found and returned succesfully

delete.description: Delete a user in an environment.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID of the target users or value user's defined External ID

post.description: Ban a user. By banning a user, all of the existing sessions will be revoked and user's cannot be issued a token or do any activities (eg. signing in, signing up, reset password, etc).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID of the target users or value user's defined External ID

post.description: Un-ban a user. By un-bannng a user, user's will be able to interact with your applications and can be issued a token and can do any activities (eg. signing in, signing up, reset password, etc).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID of the target users or value user's defined External ID

domain.description: Target domain this tokens issued to

is_password_enabled.description: Indicate whether this provider has a password value or not

is_verified.description: Indicate whether this provider is verified or not

contact_informations.description: List of contact informations related to this provider

is_verified.description: Indicate whether this contact information is verified or not

updated_at.description: UNIX Timestamp of date last updated

user_id.description: CakeAuth ID or user's defined external_id

password.description: Assign password for this provider. If this value is not empty, the `is_password_enabled` will result to `true`. And vice versa.

is_verified.description: Control whether this provider is verified or not

contact_informations.description: List of contact informations related to this provider

is_verified.description: Control whether this contact information is verified or not

is_password_enabled.description: Indicate whether this provider has a password value or not

is_verified.description: Indicate whether this provider is verified or not

contact_informations.description: List of contact informations related to this provider

is_verified.description: Indicate whether this contact information is verified or not

updated_at.description: UNIX Timestamp of date last updated

new_password.description: New password that wants to be set

force_set.description: This flags control whether password will be set to an identifier which previously has no password data (`is_password_enabled=false`). If this API was called to an identifier identifier with no previous password available and flag is **not** `true`, it will throws the [`invalid_payload`](/docs/references/errors#invalid_payload) error.

user.description: User data of the current session

identifiers.description: List of identifiers of current user's identifiers

value.description: Identifier value (e.g., email or phone number)

is_current.description: Whether this identifier is the currently active one (used in the current session data)

is_password_enabled.description: Whether a password is enabled for this identifier

is_verified.description: Whether this identifier has been verified

id.description: Random unique ID for contact information

value.description: Contact information value (e.g., email address, phone number)

is_verified.description: Whether the contact information has been verified

updated_at.description: UNIX Timestamp of date last updated
UNIX Timestamp of date last updated

user_id.description: CakeAuth ID or user's defined external_id

issue_tokens.description: This flags control whether to generate [session-access tokens pair](/docs/concepts/how-it-works/token-refresh#access-token).

token_metadata.description: Optional explicit metadata for the tokens

origin.description: Where the request comes from and where it issued to

value.description: Identifier value (e.g., email or phone number)

is_current.description: Whether this identifier is the currently active one (used in the current session data)

is_password_enabled.description: Whether a password is enabled for this identifier

is_verified.description: Whether this identifier has been verified

id.description: Random unique ID for contact information

value.description: Contact information value (e.g., email address, phone number)

is_verified.description: Whether the contact information has been verified

updated_at.description: UNIX Timestamp of date last updated
UNIX Timestamp of date last updated

external_id.description: Random ID that uniqely identified a user in an environment

value.description: Identifier value (e.g., email or phone number)

is_verified.description: Whether this identifier has been verified

value.description: Contact information value (e.g., email address, phone number)

is_verified.description: Whether the contact information has been verified
